Bash(python -c "
import jwt
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from src.config import settings

# Create a test user token
payload = {
    ''sub'': ''123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000'',  # user_id
    ''email'': ''demo@example.com'',
    ''exp'': datetime.utcnow\(\) + timedelta\(hours=24\)  # expires in 24 hours
}

# Use the better_auth_secret from settings
token = jwt.encode\(payload, settings.better_auth_secret, algorithm=''HS256''\)
print\(''Bearer Token:'', token\)
")

import jwt
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from src.config import settings
import uuid

# Generate a new user ID for test123@gmail.com
user_id = ''9e4f7abc-def1-4567-8901-fedcba987654''  # Fixed ID for this specific user
print\(f''User ID for test123@gmail.com: {user_id}''\)

# Create a token with the user ID
payload = {
    ''sub'': user_id,
    ''email'': ''test123@gmail.com'',
    ''name'': ''Testing User'',
    ''exp'': datetime.utcnow\(\) + timedelta\(hours=24\)
}

# Use the better_auth_secret from settings
token = jwt.encode\(payload, settings.better_auth_secret, algorithm=''HS256''\)
print\(f''Bearer Token: {token}''\)
")

Bash(python -c "
import importlib.util
import sys

# Try importing the users router directly to catch any errors
try:
    spec = importlib.util.spec_from_file_location\(''users_router'', ''./src/api/routers/users.py''\)
    module = importlib.util.module_from_spec\(spec\)
    spec.loader.exec_module\(module\)
    print\(''Users router imported successfully''\)
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Error importing users router: {e}''\)
    import traceback
    traceback.print_exc\(\)

# Try importing the main app
try:
    sys.path.insert\(0, ''.''\)
    from main import app
    print\(''Main app imported successfully''\)
    print\(f''Available routes: {[route.path for route in app.routes]}''\)
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Error importing main app: {e}''\)
    import traceback
    traceback.print_exc\(\)
")

try:

    print\(''Users router imported successfully''\)
    print\(f''Router routes: {[r for r in dir\(users_router\) if not r.startswith\(""_""\)]}''\)

    for route in users_router.routes:
        print\(f''Route: {route.path} - {route.methods}''\)
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Error importing users router: {e}''\)
    import traceback
    traceback.print_exc\(\)
")

Bash(python -c "
from main import app
import json

# Test if we can find the path in the app''s routes
found = False
for route in app.routes:
    if hasattr\(route, ''path''\) and route.path == ''/api/users/register'':
        print\(f''Found route: {route.path} with methods {getattr\(route, ""methods"", ""Unknown""\)}''\)
        found = True
        break

if not found:
    print\(''Route /api/users/register not found in app routes''\)
    print\(''All routes:''\)
    for route in app.routes:
        if hasattr\(route, ''path''\):
            print\(f''  {route.path}''\)
")

Bash(python -c "
from main import app

# Count total routes
total_routes = len\([r for r in app.routes if hasattr\(r, ''path''\)]\)
user_routes = len\([r for r in app.routes if hasattr\(r, ''path''\) and ''user'' in r.path.lower\(\)]\)
api_user_routes = len\([r for r in app.routes if hasattr\(r, ''path''\) and ''/api/users'' in r.path]\)

print\(f''Total routes: {total_routes}''\)
print\(f''Routes with ""user"" in path: {user_routes}''\)
print\(f''Routes with ""/api/users"" in path: {api_user_routes}''\)

# Print all /api/users routes
for route in app.routes:
    if hasattr\(route, ''path''\) and ''/api/users'' in route.path:
        print\(f''  {route.path} - {route.methods}''\)
")

Bash(python -c "
import os
from dotenv import load_dotenv
import psycopg2
from urllib.parse import urlparse

load_dotenv\(\)
db_url = os.getenv\(''DATABASE_URL''\)
parsed = urlparse\(db_url\)

conn = psycopg2.connect\(
    host=parsed.hostname,
    port=parsed.port or 5432,
    database=parsed.path.lstrip\(''/''\),
    user=parsed.username,
    password=parsed.password,
    sslmode=''require''
\)

cursor = conn.cursor\(\)
cursor.execute\(''SELECT COUNT\(*\) FROM user;''\)
result = cursor.fetchone\(\)
print\(f''Direct connection successful. User count: {result[0]}''\)

cursor.close\(\)
conn.close\(\)
")
